Other provisions eliminate loopholes, promote competition, and fight the exploitation of patients by placing fair checks on insurers, manufacturers, and drug companies. (12/12)

Click here to learn about my plan with @RepSchrader to lower drug costs: https://t.co/oFZXAvnhNj

1437816276496392195.text: Our bill works to lower prices at the pharmacy counter while preserving America’s unparalleled medical science ecosystem. We want the talent and know-how that has developed therapies and cures and the amazing COVID-19 vaccines to stay on our shores. (11/12)

1437816274839552009.text: As price-setting scares off investment, it threatens jobs in American science, especially in my district where the life sciences industry employs about 27k San Diegans. (10/12) https://t.co/MgORPV2BtZ

1437816273145061389.text: If we signal to investors through price setting that they may not be able to recoup their investment not only for their successes, but also their failures, they’ll invest elsewhere & we may well lose our ability to find cures to the toughest and rarest chronic diseases. (9/12)

1437816271366668297.text: In 2018 alone, private investment funded $102 billion of US drug development – dwarfing the budget of the NIH, and without risk to taxpayers. The cycle of risking private investment in research and development for a return down the line has generated great results. (8/12)

1437816269714120705.text:
This bill also protects America's ability to find life-saving cures.

The @USCBO found that, accounting for failures, the cost to bring a drug to market could be as high as $2 billion. That’s for just one drug or treatment. (7/12) https://t.co/VMl6py73ha

1437816268019707906.text: The Reduced Costs & Continued Cures Act empowers Medicare to negotiate with manufacturers to bring down the cost of expensive treatments when competition fails (i.e. no generic or biosimilar has been marketed & the initial period of exclusivity has expired for a product). (6/12)

1437816266291621890.text:
Our bill further reduces the cost burden on patients by ensuring that cost-sharing at the pharmacy counter is based on the drug's post-discount price rather than the drug's original list price. (5/12)
https://t.co/j9L9oFsQZb

1437816264265814023.text: We also set a ✨$50 out-of-pocket monthly maximum for insulin✨ under Medicare Part D plans. This could mean savings of $100s per month for seniors who rely on insulin to manage their diabetes but struggle to pay the expensive costs each month. (4/12)

1437816262172856321.text:
To minimize the impact on seniors with fixed incomes, we've included a 'smoothing' mechanism so that those with expensive annual drug costs can pay their out-of-pocket expenses throughout the year via monthly installments instead of all at once. (3/12) 
https://t.co/YcKySPAE3H

1437816260214116355.text:
The plan offers annual Medicare out-of-pocket caps, with greater assistance going to those who need the most help:
➡️$1.2k cap for those at ≤300% of the Federal Poverty Level (FPL)
➡️$1.8k cap for those at 300-400% of the FPL
➡️$3.1k cap for those at ≥400% of the FPL (2/12)

1437816258074927113.text:

1403040657803984902.text: My hope is to build a bipartisan, bicameral coalition around this bill and to work with all relevant stakeholders to meet our common goals. That said, I'm proud to co-lead today's resolution and am glad we are taking an important first step towards reducing methane emissions.

1403040046580649991.text:
On Earth Day, I introduced the METHANE Act to achieve ambitious methane emissions reductions, establish U.S. leadership internationally, and provide businesses with regulatory certainty and flexibility to innovate.
https://t.co/AGfda5Sy6J

1403039952733155332.text: The resolution we are marking up today moves us closer to sufficiently curbing methane emissions. But our work cannot stop here. We must work together to form an ambitious and durable long-term framework.

1403037707849318409.text: Third, our companies can lead the world in developing tech. to monitor and reduce methane emissions. Small businesses comprise two-thirds of the methane mitigation industry and represent the best of US innovation, creating economic opportunity and tackling global challenges.

1403035326327754762.text: Second, reducing methane emissions is critical to the economic competitiveness of the U.S. natural gas industry. World markets and domestic politics won't tolerate natural gas as a “bridge fuel” unless the industry can credibly prove that it has fixed its methane challenge.

1403032833434734596.text: First, controlling methane is the single most important step we can take to combat the #ClimateCrisis. Methane is a super pollutant more than 80 times as potent as CO2, and is responsible for about 25% of the human-made warming we experience today. https://t.co/qyqIaVmyY8

1403031197089939464.text:
We need to address methane emissions for several reasons. In today's mark-up, I am highlighting three:

- Overhaul @OfficeGovEthics, close loopholes for lobbyists & foreign agents, and ensure watchdogs have sufficient resources to enforce the law

1367290510688329730.text:
Lastly, to ensure public servants work for the public interest, #HR1 would:

- Expand conflict of interest law & divestment requirements, prevent members of Congress from serving on corporate boards, and require presidents to disclose tax returns (6/7)

1367290508318539780.text:
- Create a multiple matching system for small donations paid for by a new surcharge on lawbreakers, not taxpayers

- Enforce existing laws to strengthen oversight and tighten rules on super PACs (5/7)

1367290506015887360.text:
To end the power of big $ in politics, the #ForThePeopleAct would:

- Upgrade online political ad disclosure, require orgs. involved in political activity to disclose large donors, and end big $ contributors' & special interests' ability to hide funding sources (4/7)

1367290503679651840.text:
...voting, simplify voting by 📬 & ensure those who completed felony sentences have voting rights restored
- End gerrymandering, and deliver full congressional voting & self govt. for D.C. residents
- Increase election system vendors oversight (3/7)

1367290500470947842.text:
The 2020 elections proved that voter suppression persists today. Despite opposing claims, a main goal of #HR1 is to strengthen voter security & make it easier for Americans to vote. It would:

- Create automatic voter registration, expand early voting & enhance absentee... (2/7)

1359635385954013190.text: 21 reconciliation bills have become law throughout history, most recently when Republican's enacted their antigrowth tax bill in 2017. Both parties have taken advantage of reconciliation over the years, and there's no reason a reconciliation bill cannot be bipartisan.

1359635380136517632.text:
➡️After committees report out their pieces, the Budget Committee compiles all the bills into a single package that will be considered by the House & Senate.

➡️If the House & Senate adopt different versions, they must resolve any differences before a final bill is sent to @POTUS.

1359635378974695424.text:
👉Committees develop legislation aligned w/ the reconciliation instructions, though all policy details are left up to committee discretion.

(i.e. I'll join my @EnergyCommerce colleagues tomorrow to markup our section of the COVID-19 reconciliation bill:
https://t.co/SO0wzk3XGc)

1359635377242460162.text:
✅These instructions are sent to committees of jurisdiction and outline (1) the amount of $$$ each committee can earmark for the budgetary changes to be made over a certain time frame, and (2) reporting deadlines.
https://t.co/oilDf5s1X7

1359635375506026500.text:
The current reconciliation timeline:
✅Congress creates & passes a budget resolution (a plan agreed upon by the House & Senate) for the upcoming Fiscal Year. The reconciliation process is triggered when specific instructions are included in the resolution.
https://t.co/jlrNrz6TGf

1359635373585018880.text: Reconciliation is a special process that helps lawmakers change tax and mandatory spending policy. It's a tool often used to expedite time-sensitive legislation: a reconciliation bill only requires a simple majority (50 +1 votes) in the Senate instead of the traditional 60 votes.

1359635372041461770.text:

1259913804030377990.text:
Automatic stabilizers that follow economic cues are the most fiscally responsible, long-term solution to the present economic problems our country is contending. (7/7)

Read the letter, here: https://t.co/h0XPZjxTAW

1259913803094986752.text: The #coronavirus pandemic has uprooted the lives of many Americans and our country will feel the impacts of the damage for years to come. Nearly all economists agree: Congress needs to go big to save our economy. (6/7)

1259913802096787457.text:
During the last recession, Congress had to extend emergency unemployment benefits +10 times. As the weak labor market wore on, it became more difficult for Congress to meet consensus and act. 

We cannot afford to make the same mistake twice. (5/7)

1259913800934985728.text: Adopting automatic stabilizers would do just that - keep federal funding for crucial programs flowing for the duration of the current financial crisis until an economic trigger signals the additional stimulus is no longer needed and can be shut off. (4/7)

1259913799857057792.text: We know the optimal recession-fighting tools are existing countercyclical programs, like UI, FMAP, SNAP, etc. To revive our economy, it will be imperative to establish rolling federal aid that enhances these programs, as they become more widely needed in the months ahead. (3/7)

1259913798686781447.text: With over 20 million American jobs lost last month and unemployment continuing to skyrocket, we will need to face the economic calamity head-on and provide stable, ongoing relief to individuals and families across the country. (2/7)

1259913797277569025.text: THREAD: This morning, I led six of my colleagues in a letter to the Speaker, emphasizing automatic stabilizers as an essential inclusion to the next #COVID19 response package. (1/7) https://t.co/sE0dcQU40o

1250528435237277696.text: With millions of Americans relying on the essential and critical services @USPS provides, it is our responsibility to ensure that the U.S. Postal Service is supported. #SaveThePostOffice https://t.co/hiVsq0yJjt

1250141955436302336.text: It's a solution that would address the current emergency and a concept I believe worthy of broader adoption. Taking small steps to embrace automatic triggers for crucial bipartisan relief programs could allow Congress to better prepare for and mitigate future national calamities.

1250141954614181888.text: Enacting automatic triggers for #COVID19 assistance programs like #PPP or #directpayments would be a smart, efficient, fail-safe way to ensure those struggling receive the financial support they need in a timely manner without having to wait for additional congressional action.

1250141953615958017.text:
If you want to know why these stabilizers are imperative, just look at the current ad hoc pursuit of our next bill. Both parties agree these programs require more money, yet we still see prolonged, painful inaction due to negotiations over other policy.
https://t.co/IR24ms89Q7

1250141952823234564.text: Instead of relying on Congress to come together and vote on new appropriations, automatic stabilizers would keep government assistance rolling by tying the funding for these relief programs to economic or timing triggers.

1250141952038916101.text: Federal programs created to alleviate financial burdens caused by #coronavirus will run out of money before this crisis is over unless Congress passes legislation allocating more funds to keep the aid systems afloat.

1250141950856105993.text:

1243665824205979651.text: STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS ▶️ a total of $150 billion placed in a new Coronavirus Relief Fund, which state, tribal and local governments can use to meet costs connected to the virus. California will receive $15.3 billion, more than any other state.

1243665823228665857.text: FOR HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS ▶️ $100 billion for hospitals and health care providers on the front lines, $1.32 billion for community health centers, and $4.3 billion for local and state public health agencies to purchase crucial #PPE, lab testing, and other preparedness activities.

1243665822171762689.text: FOR STUDENTS ▶️ $30 billion to schools in emergency funding, paused payments for federal student loan borrowers and makes employer-provided student loan assistance tax free (thanks to my bill, the Employer Participation in Repayment Act!).

1243665821081251842.text:

1233164341421236225.text: ☑️ The Protecting Business Opportunities for Veterans Act would protect veteran-owned small businesses by directing the VA to work with the VA OIG to identify and penalize small businesses who take advantage of the Vets First Program, reducing the fraud and abuse in contracting.

1233164340410355712.text: ☑️ The VA Reporting Transparency Act would require the VA to launch and maintain a website that includes all public reports to Congress, increasing transparency and accessibility to better serve the veteran community.

1233164339538006016.text: ☑️ The Legal Services for Homeless Veterans Act would strengthen the help available to veterans facing certain legal issues that could lead them on a path to homelessness by establishing VA grants for organizations that provide legal services to homeless or at-risk vets.

1233164338216816640.text: ☑️ The GIVE Act would require the VA to provide additional information for the GI Bill Comparison Tool, important to veterans trying to decide which college to attend.

1233164337323311104.text: ☑️ The Gold Star Spouses and Spouses of Injured Servicemembers Leasing Relief Expansion Act would allow spouses of critically injured service members to terminate property and automobile leases, and surviving spouses to terminate automobile leases.

1207428293776986112.text: In our nation's history, thousands have gone into battle to fight for our democracy. In contrast, my Republican colleagues will not speak up for rule of law or against presidential abuse of power. That's the tragedy of today's events. #DefendOurDemocracy https://t.co/GNmQwTn1Bv

1207357067616382976.text: In contrast, for fear of losing an election, my colleagues will not speak up for rule of law or against presidential abuse of power. Those who don’t actively excuse the behavior will remain silent and cowardly. Voters may give them a pass, but history will judge them harshly.

1207357066550988802.text: That’s the tragedy of today’s events. In our nation’s history, thousands of Americans have gone into battle to fight for our democracy. Those young people served without reservation, as they still do today. Many were gravely injured and some made the ultimate sacrifice.

1207357065745727489.text: Republicans say they want to avoid impeachment, but what choice do they give us? They refuse to seek the truth and condemn the abuse of power to prevent it in the future.

1207357064575471616.text: I believe the president’s actions warrant removal from office, but we could have an honest debate. What's not up for debate is what happened, or whether it’s wrong. It’s historically criminal and unpatriotic.

1207357063438856192.text: No House Republican has joined in to demand the documents or witnesses that the president has refused to produce. And Senate Republican leaders have announced that he himself can set the rules of his own trial.

1207356249857118208.text: Republicans have not sought the truth; they have sought to avoid it. They have demeaned and insulted witnesses–patriots, warriors, career diplomats–who have provided evidence against the president.

1207356083133534208.text: Many have lamented that this effort is not bipartisan. That’s up to my Republican colleagues. I’ve had enough of the “both sides” rhetoric that characterizes today’s punditry and journalism. Republicans have excused Trump’s crimes or pretended they didn’t happen.

1207355929886199808.text: The president also obstructed Congress by refusing to allow witnesses to testify. He is not exercising a privilege over particular evidence or testimony. He is just saying Congress can’t have information. This is unprecedented and a violation of our separation of powers. https://t.co/f75RIdbwHv

1207355050890158080.text: He pressured Ukraine to interfere in the 2020 elections, just as the Mueller Report showed his campaign cooperated with Russia as it interfered in our 2016 elections. That is an abuse of power—the very type our founders referred to when they put impeachment in the Constitution.

1207355049623441408.text: The facts are not disputed. The president withheld nearly $400 million in foreign aid and a White House meeting from Ukraine in order to force that foreign official to investigate one of the president’s political rivals. There is no counter-narrative.

1207355048436518913.text: Today, I will vote to impeach President Donald Trump, consistent with my promise to defend the Constitution from all enemies, foreign and domestic. It’s now up to the Senate to conduct a trial to decide whether the president should be removed from office.

1181700611647000576.text: Thank you to our partners that support the Build More Housing Near Transit Act and joined us today including @SupFletcher, @SANDAG, @CirculateSD, and @Up4Growth (including its members: SDHC and Monarch Group).

1181700610908811264.text: Therefore, federal investment in a large-scale transit project has the potential to address our housing shortage, to mitigate our urgent climate crisis, and to improve quality of life for our communities.

1181700610166444032.text: The bill also ensures there is a local commitment to change land-use policies to accommodate market-rate and affordable housing before the transit project receives funding.

1181700609478541312.text: The Mid-Coast Trolley is an example of a New Starts project currently under construction in San Diego. Under our bill, similar projects would have to determine how and where housing units could be built near new transit stops.

1181700606093754368.text: Today, we announced our bill, the Build More Housing Near Transit Act, which would require applicants to the FTA's New Starts program—which funds transit projects like commuter rail, light rail, and bus rapid transit—to include housing feasibility assessments in their proposal. https://t.co/UHuh53rI95

1149787089942138880.text: If you are arrested or detained, you have the right to speak to a lawyer immediately. Non-citizens have the right to speak to their home country's embassy or consulate.

1149787089401081857.text: You have the right to speak to a lawyer before you sign any documents and can refuse to sign before seeking legal advice.

1149787088608358400.text: If ICE agents come to your home, you do NOT have to open the door. You can ask to see a search warrant and you have the right to refuse ICE permission to enter your home if they cannot present a warrant *signed by a judge.*

1149787087824011264.text: If you are approached by ICE agents or police, you have the right to remain silent and do NOT have to reveal your immigration status. You cannot be forced to answer questions.

1144016351805095936.text: It also provides $60 million to reimburse states, local governments, and non-government organizations, which have shouldered the burden of humanitarian assistance, for the cost of care.

1144016351050076160.text: It also blocks the Trump Administration’s threat to withhold aid from Guatemala, Honduras, and El Salvador. This aid is essential to address the root causes that force people to flee their homes in the first place.

1144016350249013248.text: It funds support services for unaccompanied children and provides urgently-needed funding for food, shelter, clothing, medical care, and legal assistance to help relieve the horrific over-crowding and help prevent additional deaths.

1144016349535952897.text: Our border policies should reflect our values. The House passed $4.5B in emergency spending to address the humanitarian crisis at the border. It ensures migrants are treated with dignity and aims to address the root causes that drive people to the U.S. in the first place.

1143984072957370368.text: @justinamash And now we are assigned another solemn task by the Constitution and by current events. We need to begin impeachment hearings.

1143983975817310208.text: @justinamash Democrats are leading on the problems facing Americans: health care, ethics in government, comprehensive immigration reform and border security, gun safety, and civil rights. We must continue to pass groundbreaking legislation, as we have, and as we were elected to do.

1143983866773774336.text: @justinamash "Our system of checks and balances relies on each branch jealously guarding its powers and upholding its duties under our Constitution. When loyalty to a political party or to an individual trumps loyalty to the Constitution, the Rule of Law–the foundation of liberty–crumbles.”

1143983792001966080.text: @justinamash is right: “The risk we face in an environment of extreme partisanship is not that Congress will employ [impeachment] as a remedy too often but rather that Congress will employ it so rarely that it cannot deter misconduct..." https://t.co/PkhS2aiBTM

1143983660602810368.text: If we don’t act, we send the message that criminal behavior is normal for presidents. Trump will be more emboldened to ignore Congress. And we will increase cynicism among those who depend on us to uphold the law and the Constitution. None of that is acceptable.

1143983593837907969.text: We should never pursue impeachment for political reasons. Nor should we avoid it for political reasons. It’s Congress’ job to determine whether the president broke the law and acted against the interests of the United States.

1143983535704793088.text: Some argue impeachment poses a political risk for Democrats. They say Republicans will claim Trump was vindicated regardless of the outcome. That gives Americans too little credit. I trust them to discern which of us did our patriotic duty and who played to political cynicism.

1143983451839717376.text: Impeachment is not about the president’s character or policies. It’s about upholding the rule of law and defending the Constitution. It’s about whether he has broken the law. The Mueller Report contains plenty of evidence that he did. Hearings may produce more such evidence.

1143983344331345920.text: We’ve seen terrible policies from Trump: dangerous foreign policy, tariffs that hurt Americans, reckless tax cuts, cruelty toward asylum-seekers, and attempts to rip health care from millions. I disagree with Trump's policies, but they're for elections, not impeachment.

1143983261074333696.text: Impeachment is not a redo of the election. Voters accepted a lot that I found appalling: mocking the disabled, childish name calling, attacking war heroes and Gold Star families, insulting Muslims and Mexicans. But while this behavior is abhorrent, it is for voters to judge.

1143983044425994240.text: The Constitution provides that the president “shall be removed from Office, on Impeachment for, and Conviction of, Treason, Bribery, or other high Crimes and Misdemeanors.” Nobody disputes that felony obstruction of justice is a “high crime” under the Constitution.

1143982998284406784.text: Mueller himself said he did NOT exonerate the president. He felt he could not prosecute Trump because of a DOJ rule against indicting a sitting president. He made it clear it's up to Congress to take further action. Given the record presented, we are duty-bound to proceed.

1143982886409781249.text: The report also details 10 instances of obstruction of justice by the president, while in office. Over 1,000 former federal prosecutors from both political parties said this evidence is enough to support prosecution and conviction on felony obstruction of justice charges. https://t.co/lWYmYwgllE

1143982649582616576.text: The Trump campaign was willing and eager to work with a foreign adversary to interfere in our elections. This is far more significant wrongdoing even than the Watergate break-in and its subsequent cover-up which led to Nixon’s impeachment and resignation.

1143982610432970754.text: Mueller found a ton of corruption: 34 guilty pleas or indictments of individuals and companies. Five of Trump’s highest-level associates pleaded guilty to serious felonies, including his campaign chairman, personal lawyer, and national security advisor.

1143982551226183680.text: My colleagues and I have supported the work of Special Counsel Mueller’s examination of Russian interference in our elections. I withheld comment on impeachment out of deference to Mueller’s work and his professionalism. But now we have the report, and it’s shocking.

1143934699338792960.text: The right to vote is an essential part of our democracy. Sadly, the #ShelbyVHolder Supreme Court decision weakened voter protections from discrimination, intimidation, and disenfranchisement. We must #RestoretheVote to ensure every American has equal access to the ballot box.

1123693252467724288.text:
Mr. President: We get that you don’t like President Obama’s climate action ideas. 

Congress has a #ClimatePlaybook. Mr. President, tell us yours.
#HR9 #ClimateActionNow

1123692980152537089.text:
@EPAAWheeler @EnergyCommerce That’s the point of the #ClimateActionNow Act, which simply invites the President to tell us his strategy.

There are many bipartisan options and we don't even need the president to draft new ideas. The #ClimatePlaybook has 53 bills we can act on right now.

1123692840566120448.text:
Yet, @EPAAWheeler came to @EnergyCommerce last month and agreed climate change is happening and is largely driven by human activity.

So, the question is: What climate plan does President Trump support?

1123692545861664768.text:
President Trump has made clear what climate action he doesn’t like:
• the Paris Agreement, which set a global target to reduce GHGs
• the Clean Power Plan, which encourages states to lower GHGs
• CAFE standards, which required automakers to lower car and truck emissions

1123692427938758663.text: Today, the House is considering the Climate Action Now Act, one of the bills in the #ClimatePlaybook, my comprehensive plan to slow and reverse the rate of climate change. 1116066397983916032.text:
@ARPAE Tackling climate change is an opportunity to increase our energy independence, raise our standard of living, ensure future generations
have clean air and water, and develop a workforce to make it all possible. I look forward to working with my colleagues to #ActonClimate now.

1116066229888774145.text: @ARPAE The #ClimatePlaybook is online so anyone who wants to can read it, critique it, or make suggestions. You can do that here >> 📧  https://t.co/TdizZpRAEW

1116066098057580544.text: @ARPAE To be clear, this is only the beginning of a conversation and the #ClimatePlaybook invites new ideas on how to improve these bills – which are mostly bipartisan and therefore, have a good shot at becoming law. Now it’s time to get to work—together.

1116065851206062082.text: Finally, federal investment in programs like @ARPAE and the SunShot Initiative help accelerate ground-breaking energy technology. The government must support every stage of energy innovation from energy research and development to demonstration and deployment. https://t.co/Qj98TeXqpX

1116065659257888768.text: A transition to a clean energy economy will disproportionately affect low-income communities. We need to invest in job retraining, income support, and help workers in the coal and petroleum industry. This will keep our economy strong and ensure a successful transition for all. https://t.co/hL6AV7DCk8

1116065274401136640.text: Natural disasters caused by climate change have increased in cost and frequency. The federal government must give communities across the U.S. the resources and information they need to develop and improve their extreme weather resiliency efforts. https://t.co/ZNHzxSEL8N

1116065111972634624.text: The U.S. must also reclaim our global leadership on climate by re-entering the #ParisAgreement, meeting our commitments to Canada & Mexico, and ratifying the Kigali Amendment to the Montreal Protocol. We also need to recognize climate change as a national security threat. https://t.co/bw90CJWVeO

1116064906309070848.text: Super pollutants are much more potent than CO2 and stay in the atmosphere longer. We can cut these emissions quickly by supporting methane capture, better agricultural practices, low-emission refrigeration systems, and a national framework for transitioning away from HFCs. https://t.co/sCLh7NFIeF

1116064741439365120.text: Methane emissions from livestock, and certain soil and manure management practices are some of the most potent sources of direct emissions. Improving agricultural practices and creating programs for carbon offsetting projects are market-based tools that can reduce emissions. https://t.co/vtYc8fj1Xg

1116064340862357504.text: The residential and commercial building sector accounts for almost 40% of U.S. energy consumption. While commercial and residential buildings are much more efficient now, we can do more to offset the emissions created by increased use of appliances and electronics. https://t.co/1mLb7I5Gys

1116064175065690112.text: U.S. manufacturing accounts for 12% of GDP, 31% of energy consumption, and 21% of annual greenhouse gas emissions. Promoting energy efficiency, less carbon-intensive fuels, and other mitigation technologies is key to quickly reducing emissions in this sector. https://t.co/PSEwXFQjUt

1116064033373736960.text: Reducing emissions from the electricity sector requires investments in low-carbon, renewable, and zero-carbon emitting technologies. We also need to reform the energy market to successfully transition to a clean energy economy. https://t.co/YjmnTagb2i

1116063806466093057.text: The U.S. transportation sector is the largest source of greenhouse gas emissions. We can reduce that by using alternative fuels, such as biofuels and hydrogen, improving fuel efficiency, and modernizing the grid for electric cars. https://t.co/8wLznQqVoD

1116063546792497152.text: Economists agree a #CarbonTax offers the most cost-effective incentive to reduce emissions. The majority of American families could benefit from rebates that offset the hardship of increased energy prices. https://t.co/n5ccmb8v2H

1116063373399973889.text: First, we need economy-wide incentives at all levels of government and in partnership with other countries. This includes upholding our commitment to the #ParisAgreement and establishing federal programs in the U.S. to prevent the average global temperature from rising. https://t.co/IIgv5Vmbvu

1116062400355000320.text: The #ClimatePlaybook is a list of bills already introduced by Republicans and Democrats—some with bipartisan support. Together, they would take immediate steps to reduce greenhouse gasses and slow—even reverse—the effects of climate change.

1116062037518376960.text:
Climate change and its effects are undeniable. Scientists warn we must make unprecedented changes to avoid the worst effects. Policymakers and the public agree we must act now and that's why we need the #ClimatePlaybook.
https://t.co/2rvG5jvgYG

1113914229323493376.text: Finally, #VAWA19 redefines the individuals prohibited from purchasing firearms because they were convicted of domestic violence to include dating and former partners. It also prohibits people convicted of stalking misdemeanors from possessing firearms.
